articles.title: International Business Machines Corp. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors
articles.summary: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) stock fell 0.91% to $128.48 on Friday, May 20, 2022, underperforming the broader stock market, which saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average rise slightly. This marked the third consecutive day of losses for IBM, leaving its stock $17.51 below its 52-week high. While IBM declined, some competitors showed mixed performance, with Apple Inc. (AAPL) rising and Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) and Alphabet Inc. Cl A (GOOGL) falling.

articles.title: SEIV ETF Analysis: Dividends, Returns CBOE:SEIV
articles.summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of the SEI Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Value Factor ETF (SEIV), focusing on its dividends, returns, and key characteristics. It highlights SEIV as an actively managed fund targeting US large-cap value stocks using a quantitative-based selection process. The analysis covers AUM, expense ratio, holdings breakdown by sector and region, and dividend history, including a 24.49% increase in its last reported dividend.

articles.title: Read This Before You Buy Any Udemy Course
articles.summary: This article provides essential tips for purchasing courses on Udemy, emphasizing avoiding impulse buys due to frequent discounts and supporting instructors by using their direct links. It also advises against coupon sites and recommends buying courses via a desktop browser in incognito mode for the best pricing.

articles.title: Unity Software loses $5 billion in market cap after Apple's changes lead to 'self-inflicted wound'
articles.summary: Unity Software's market cap dropped by $5 billion after the company's attempts to circumvent Apple's IDFA changes backfired, leading to a "self-inflicted wound." Wall Street punished Unity U stock, slashing price targets by 43% as their workaround negatively impacted ad accuracy. Unity executives' strategy concerning Apple's mobile operating system changes proved ineffective, resulting in a significant market downturn for the company.

articles.title: Online dating giant Match Group sues Google over app store
articles.summary: Match Group, the company behind popular dating apps like Tinder and OkCupid, has sued Google, alleging an illegal monopoly in the Google Play Store and anticompetitive in-app payment policies. Match Group claims Google's 30% cut of in-app purchases and its mandate to use Google's payment technology are harmful, especially as Google threatened to remove Match apps from the Play Store if they don't comply with new rules. Google, in response, argues Match Group is trying to avoid paying for services and that the majority of apps on its platform do not pay fees.

articles.title: How Citizens Financial used an iPhone plan to create a nationwide digital bank
articles.summary: Citizens Financial Group Inc. launched its Citizens Pay iPhone upgrade plan in 2015, an early iteration of the buy-now-pay-later model. This initiative allowed Citizens to leverage its brand as a credit provider in conjunction with Apple's iPhone, helping customers bypass long waits for new iPhone releases. The article explores how this strategy contributes to Citizens' nationwide digital banking efforts.

articles.title: Tinder owner Match sues Google in 'last resort' to avoid app-store booting
articles.summary: Match Group Inc., owner of dating apps like Tinder, has sued Alphabet Inc.'s Google, describing it as a "last resort" to prevent its apps from being removed from the Google Play store. Match is contesting Google's policy of demanding up to 30% of sales from apps and threatening to block downloads unless Match uses Google's payment system exclusively. The lawsuit accuses Google of violating antitrust laws and seeks to protect Match from potentially hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue payments to Google.

articles.title: Former Senior Vice President of Autonomous Driving at VW Group Alexander Hitzinger Joins Arbe Board of Directors
articles.summary: Alexander Hitzinger, former Senior Vice President of Autonomous Driving at VW Group, has joined Arbe's Board of Directors. Hitzinger brings extensive experience from top automotive and new mobility firms, including Volkswagen and Apple, to Arbe. His addition is expected to help Arbe revolutionize the radar industry and advance safe autonomous driving solutions.

articles.title: Starbucks to cover employees’ travel expenses for abortions; gender surgeries
articles.summary: Starbucks announced an expansion of its health care benefits to cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortions or gender-affirming procedures if these services are not available within 100 miles of their homes. This decision comes in the wake of a leaked draft U.S. Supreme Court opinion potentially overturning Roe v. Wade, with the company affirming its commitment to ensuring employee access to quality healthcare. Starbucks joins other major companies in offering this benefit, consistent with its history of advocating for liberal causes.

articles.title: Home Audio Equipment Market size to Increase by USD 14.39 Bn | Featuring Top Vendors Including Apple Inc., Bose Corp., Koninklijke Philips NV, and Kripa Electronics India Pvt. Ltd. | Technavio
articles.summary: The global home audio equipment market is projected to grow by USD 14.39 billion between 2020 and 2025, exhibiting a CAGR of 10.76%. This growth is primarily driven by rising disposable incomes and technological innovations, especially in the smart speakers segment. Key vendors include Apple Inc., Bose Corp., Koninklijke Philips NV, and others.

articles.title: Grand Investment Opportunity Awaits in the Metaverse
articles.summary: Despite the current downturn in growth and technology stocks, the metaverse offers a significant long-term investment opportunity. The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) is presented as a viable option for investors who wish to capitalize on this emerging concept without individual stock picking, holding familiar large-cap tech companies. Experts believe the metaverse has the potential to transform social media, gaming, shopping, entertainment, and education.

articles.title: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America return to Fortune 500
articles.summary: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America have rejoined the Fortune 500 list. Walmart topped the overall list, followed by Amazon and Apple. The article also mentions other related business news.
